page.title: 10Bradley Endowed First School
page.content: The school is Victorian and stands opposite the church in the middle of the village. It is built of red brick with a red tiled roof. There is central porch with a bell tower above it.The doors open into two classrooms.They are separated by large doors which can be opened to form a single room.A later addition runs along the back of the school.This contains toilets,cloakroom kitchen and office.The old toilets have been made into an extra classroom. There is a playground around the school. Behind the school is a playing field with swings and slides.A large hard area at the end of the field can be used for tennis.The field is open to the public out of school time.Although it is a small school with just two teachers it has modern equipment eg. colour television,video, jumbo typewriter and a computer.
